geolosys.field_manual.tooltip: Everything you need to know about mining with Geolosys!
geolosys.pro_pick.tooltip: Useful when paired with a compass!
geolosys.pro_pick.tooltip.nonefound_ston: No special stones in this area
itemGroup.geolosys.name: §8Geolosys§r
geolosys.download.error.string:
The geolosys.json ore config file could neither be found nor downloaded.
You can download the file at https://raw.githubusercontent.com/oitsjustjose/Geolosys/1.14.x/geolosys_ores.json and put it in your config folder manually if you wish (it will need to be renamed "geolosys.json").
geolosys.guide.page.home.name: Field Manual
geolosys.guide.chapter.introduction.name: Introduction
geolosys.guide.chapter.prospecting.name: Prospecting
geolosys.guide.chapter.resources.name: Resources
geolosys.guide.chapter.mod_compat.name: Inter-Mod Compat
geolosys.guide.chapter.patrons.name: Patrons
geolosys.guide.chapter.getting_started.t: Geolosys is a mod which is meant to add difficulty to mining, similar to TerraFirmaCraft. In essence, world ore deposits are more realistic. You'll start out by finding samples on the surface, which lie above the larger mineral deposit underground. When you do, start digging! Refer to Prospecting for more.
geolosys.guide.chapter.vanilla_ores.name: Vanilla Resources
geolosys.guide.chapter.vanilla_ores.text: If configured to be enabled by Geolosys, Geolosys will override any Vanilla ore generation. This means that it'll be your main source of vanilla materials like Iron, Coal, etc.. HINT: Quartz isn't in the nether anymore! Need a vanilla ore block for crafting? That's fine! You can silk-touch any Geolosys vanilla replacement to get the original vanilla variant.
geolosys.guide.chapter.modded_ores.name: Modded Resources
geolosys.guide.chapter.modded_ores.text: Geolosys also adds the basic modded materials to ore generation, with samples and clusters to correspond.
geolosys.guide.chapter.samples.name: Samples
geolosys.guide.chapter.samples_1.text: Samples (shown above) lie on the surface above a large, underground mineral deposit. These samples can (if not disabled) drop an item to help you figure out what the deposit beneath actually contains. You can break them either normally or via right-click.
geolosys.guide.chapter.samples_2.text: Some samples drop clusters (as do mineral deposits). These can be smelted or processed just like any other ore.
geolosys.guide.chapter.propick.name: Prospector's Pick
geolosys.guide.chapter.propick_1.text: The Prospector's Pick is a useful tool after you've been rummaging around underground long enough. Made with a decent amount of iron, it can be used for a few things.
geolosys.guide.chapter.propick_2.text: First, when held, it'll reveal chunk borders (if enabled): this is useful for distinguishing where to start/stop digging, as mineral deposits start in the same chunk that you'll find their respective sample. It'll also show you your current Y-level (if enabled).
geolosys.guide.chapter.propick_3.text: Additionally, when right-clicked above sea-level, it'll tell you what deposit is in that chunk (in case you can't find a sample around...). Once underground, it'll scan a configurable area (5x5x5 by default) in the direction you've clicked and tell you if it finds a mineral.
geolosys.guide.chapter.stones.name: Stone Variants
geolosys.guide.chapter.stones.text: Vanilla stone variants can be (if enabled) clustered into large plutons, instead of generating sporadically throughout the world.
geolosys.guide.chapter.ore.description: %1$s can be found between %2$s and %3$s, in any biome. It has a %4$s percent chance of generating and comes in plutons of sizes around %5$s blocks. The harvest level of this deposit is %6$s.
geolosys.guide.chapter.ore.multi.descrip: %1$s can be found between %2$s and %3$s, in any biome. The deposit as a whole has a %4$s percent chance of generating and comes in plutons of sizes around %5$s blocks. The highest harvest level of this deposit is %6$s.
geolosys.guide.chapter.ore.biome.descrip: %1$s can be found between %2$s and %3$s, and only in %4$s biomes. It has a %5$s percent chance of generating and comes in plutons of sizes around %6$s blocks. The harvest level of this deposit is %7$s.
geolosys.guide.chapter.ore.mutli.biome.d: %1$s can be found between %2$s and %3$s, and only in %4$s biomes. The deposit as a whole has a %5$s percent chance of generating and comes in plutons of sizes around %6$s blocks. The highest harvest level of this deposit is %7$s.
geolosys.guide.chapter.ore_converter.tex: The Ore Converter feature converts ALL non-Geolosys ores to Geolosys ores in a chunk. This happens §oonce§r, when the player §ofirst§r visits a chunk.
geolosys.guide.chapter.journeymap.name: JourneyMap
geolosys.guide.chapter.journeymap.text: When right-clicking a sample, a waypoint named for what the objet is is added to your JourneyMap minimap.
geolosys.guide.chapter.immersive_enginee: Aside from Coal dropping Sulfur, the Core Sample Drill and Excavator will detect and mine Geolosys §oore§r blocks.
If Better With Mods is installed, all smelting recipes will output nuggets instead of ingots.
geolosys.guide.chapter.twilight_forest.t: If in the Twilight Forest dimension, all ores will generate scaled to the Twilight Forest's shorter world height.
geolosys.guide.chapter.applied_energisti: If AE is installed, Certus Quartz can drop from Assorted Quartz at an 8% chance. In addition, Charged Certus Quartz can drop at a 4% chance.
geolosys.guide.chapter.extra_utils.name: Extra Utilities 2
geolosys.guide.chapter.extra_utils.text: If Extra Utilities 2 is installed, Redstone Crystals can drop from Cinnabar at a 3.33% chance.
geolosys.guide.chapter.actually_addition: If Actually Additions is installed, Black Quartz can drop from Assorted Quartz at an 8% chance.
geolosys.guide.chapter.cofh_mods.name: Thermal Foundation
geolosys.guide.chapter.cofh_mods.text: If Thermal Foundation is installed, then Cinnabar can drop from Cinnabar at a 3.33% chance.
geolosys.guide.chapter.mekanism.name: Mekanism
geolosys.guide.chapter.mekanism.text: If Osmium is enabled in the config, Platinum will split its drop chance 50%% with Osmium. If Osmium is enabled §oexclusively§r, then Osmium will be the only drop from Platinum.
If Yellorium is enabled in the config, Autunite will split its drop chance 50%% with Yellorium.
geolosys.guide.chapter.nuclearcraft.name: NuclearCraft
geolosys.guide.chapter.nuclearcraft.text: If NuclearCraft is installed, Geolosys's Vanilla Ore variants will drop NuclearCraft's usual added drops, with the same chance as NuclearCraft.
geolosys.guide.chapter.patrons.none.text: I don't seem to have any Patrons currently :(|This portion of the Field Manual is dedicated to all my patrons - if you'd like to show up in this list, support my work by clicking the button below ♡
geolosys.guide.chapter.patrons.desc.text: This portion of the Field Manual is dedicated to all my patrons - thank you!! If you'd like to show up in this list, support my work by clicking the button below ♡
